data.enText: lowest part
the lowest part of sth, especially the part or surface on which it rests or stands
the base of a column/glass
a pain at the base of the spine
The lamp has a heavy base.
original idea/situation
an idea, a fact, a situation, etc. from which sth is developed

data.chText: 她以她的家族史作为小说的素材。
data.enText: She used her family's history as a base for her novel.

data.chText: 他的论点有充分的经济上的根据。
data.enText: His arguments have a sound economic base.
of support/income/power

data.chText: （支持、收入、力量等的）来源，源泉，基础
data.enText: the people, activity, etc. from which sb/sth gets most of their support, income, power, etc.

data.chText: 这些政策受到广泛支持。
data.enText: These policies have a broad base of support.

data.chText: 以制造业为坚实基础的经济体
data.enText: an economy with a solid manufacturing base
first/main substance

data.chText: 混合物的首要（或主要）成分
data.enText: the first or main part of a substance to which other things are added

data.chText: 主要成分为朗姆酒的饮料
data.enText: a drink with a rum base

data.chText: 化妆前先搽些润肤霜打底。
data.enText: Put some moisturizer on as a base before applying your make-up.
main place
the main place where you live or stay or where a business operates from

data.chText: 我有很多时间在英国度过，但主要还是居住在巴黎。
data.enText: I spend a lot of time in Britain but Paris is still my base.

data.chText: 这个镇子是在这一地区旅游观光的理想据点。
data.enText: The town is an ideal base for touring the area.

data.chText: 公司总部设在纽约，分支遍及全世界。
data.enText: The company has its base in New York, and branch offices all over the world.
of army, navy, etc.
a place where an army, a navy, etc. operates from
a military/naval base
an air base

data.chText: 他们发动攻击之后返回了基地。
data.enText: After the attack, they returned to base.
chemistry
a chemical substance, for example an alkali , that can combine with an acid to form a salt
mathematics

data.chText: 基数（如十进制的10和二进制的2）
data.enText: a number on which a system of counting and expressing numbers is built up, for example 10 in the decimal system and 2 in the binary system
in baseball/rounders
one of the four positions that a player must reach in order to score points
off base
completely wrong about sth

data.chText: 你如果那么想就全错了。
data.enText: If that's what you think, you're way off base.
cover all the bases
to consider and deal with all the things that could happen or could be needed when you are arranging sth
touch base (with sb)
to make contact with sb again

data.chText: 以…为据点（或总部等）；把（总部等）设在
data.enText: to use a particular city, town, etc. as the main place for a business, holiday/vacation, etc.

data.chText: 他们决定将新成立的公司总部设在约克郡。
data.enText: They decided to base the new company in York.

data.chText: 我们将以东京为据点到各地旅行。
data.enText: We're going to base ourselves in Tokyo and make trips from there.
base sth on/upon sth
to use an idea, a fact, a situation, etc. as the point from which sth can be developed

data.chText: 你这种理论的根据是什么？
data.enText: What are you basing this theory on?
baser
basest
not having moral principles or rules
He acted from base motives.

data.chText: 以上各词均指基础、根据。
data.enText: These are all words for the ideas or facts that sth is based on.
basis
[usually sing.] a principle, an idea or a fact that supports sth and that it can develop from

data.chText: 这篇文章将作为我们讨论的基点。
data.enText: This article will form the basis for our discussion.
foundation
[usually sing.] a principle, an idea or a fact that supports sth and that it develops from

data.chText: 尊重和伴侣关系是婚姻的牢固基础。
data.enText: Respect and friendship provide a solid foundation for marriage.
The rumour is totally without foundation (= is not based on any facts) .

data.chText: 与basis相比，foundation常用以指更大、更重要的事物：
data.enText: Foundation is often used to talk about larger or more important things than basis .

data.chText: 他奠定了日本现代经济的基础。
data.enText: He laid the foundation of Japan's modern economy.

data.chText: 这些数字是他们要求提高工资的根据。
data.enText: These figures formed the basis of their pay claim.
basis or foundation?
base
[usually sing.] an idea, a fact or a situation from which sth is developed

data.chText: 他的论点在经济上有充分的根据。
data.enText: His arguments have a sound economic base.
a/the basis/foundation/base for/of sth
a secure/solid/sound/strong/weak basis/foundation/base
to form the basis/foundation/base of sth
to give sb/provide (sb with) a/the basis/foundation/base
to threaten/undermine the basis/foundations of sth
to be without basis/foundation

data.chText: 以上各词均指底部、最下部。
data.enText: These are all words for the lowest part of sth.
bottom
[usually sing.] the lowest part of sth
Footnotes are given at the bottom of each page.
I waited for them at the bottom of the hill.
base
[usually sing.] the lowest part of sth, especially the part or surface on which it rests or stands
The lamp has a heavy base.
foundation
[usually pl.] a layer of bricks, concrete, etc. that forms the solid underground base of a building
to lay the foundations of the new school
foot
[sing.] the lowest part of sth

data.chText: 她在楼梯底转过身来面对着他。
data.enText: At the foot of the stairs she turned to face him.

data.chText: foot用于有限的一些事物，最常与tree、hill/mountain、steps/stairs和page等连用。bottom适用的范围要广得多，其中也包括上面提到的与foot搭配的词。foot一般用于文学性较强的语境中。
data.enText: Foot is used to talk about a limited number of things: it is used most often with tree , hill/mountain , steps/stairs and page . Bottom can be used to talk about a much wider range of things, including those mentioned above for foot . Foot is generally used in more literary contexts.
bottom or foot?
at/near/towards the bottom/base/foot of sth
on the bottom/base of sth
(a) firm/solid/strong base/foundation(s)

simple_means.memory_skill: bas 低，下；基础 + e → 低下的

means: 混合物的首要（或主要）成分

ex.chText: 良好的科研基础保障了去年经济目标的完成。
ex.enText: A good scientific research base ensures the achievement of last year's economic goals.

synonyms.bx: 指某事物的基底部分，一般用单数。也可以指知识、想法等的基础或军事组织的基地。

ex.enText: the basis of equality and mutual benefit

synonyms.bx: 指支持某事物并构成其发展基础的重要事实、观念、事、物等。

ex.chText: 工人们正在加固大桥的地基。
ex.enText: The workers are strengthening the foundation of the bridge.

ex.chText: 这条理论是有事实根据的。
ex.enText: This theory is built on a foundation of factual knowledge.

synonyms.bx: 指建筑物的地基，也可用来表示思想基础或基本原理。

data.enText: off base
completely wrong about sth

data.chText: 你如果那么想就全错了。
data.enText: If that's what you think, you're way off base.
cover all the bases
to consider and deal with all the things that could happen or could be needed when you are arranging sth
not get to first base (with sth/sb)

data.chText: （工程、关系等）未能顺利开始，未能跨出第一步
data.enText: to fail to make a successful start in a project, relationship, etc.; to fail to get through the first stage
touch base (with sb)
to make contact with sb again
base sth on/upon sth
to use an idea, a fact, a situation, etc. as the point from which sth can be developed

data.chText: 你这种理论的根据是什么？
data.enText: What are you basing this theory on?

tr: a support or foundation
example: the base of the lamp

tr: a place that the runner must touch before scoring
example: he scrambled to get back to the bag

tr: (electronics) the part of a transistor that separates the emitter from the collector
installation from which a military force initiates operations
example: the attack wiped out our forward bases

tr: a flat bottom on which something is intended to sit
example: a tub should sit on its own base

tr: the principal ingredient of a mixture
example: glycerinated gelatin is used as a base for many ointments
he told the painter that he wanted a yellow base with just a hint of green
everything she cooked seemed to have rice as the base

tr: lowest support of a structure
example: it was built on a base of solid rock
he stood at the foot of the tower

tr: the stock of basic facilities and capital equipment needed for the functioning of a country or area
example: the industrial base of Japan

tr: the fundamental assumptions from which something is begun or developed or calculated or explained
example: the whole argument rested on a basis of conjecture

tr: (linguistics) the form of a word after all affixes are removed
example: thematic vowels are part of the stem

tr: a lower limit
example: the government established a wage floor

tr: the place where you are stationed and from which missions start and end
(anatomy) the part of an organ nearest its point of attachment
example: the base of the skull

tr: the bottom or lowest part
example: the base of the mountain

tr: (numeration system) the positive integer that is equivalent to one in the next higher counting place
example: 10 is the radix of the decimal system

tr: the most important or necessary part of something
example: the basis of this drink is orange juice

tr: the bottom side of a geometric figure from which the altitude can be constructed
example: the base of the triangle

tr: any of various water-soluble compounds capable of turning litmus blue and reacting with an acid to form a salt and water
example: bases include oxides and hydroxides of metals and ammonia

tr: a phosphoric ester of a nucleoside
the basic structural unit of nucleic acids (DNA or RNA)
use as a basis for
found on
example: base a claim on some observation

tr: use (purified cocaine) by burning it and inhaling the fumes
situate as a center of operations
example: we will base this project in the new lab

tr: debased
not genuine
example: an attempt to eliminate the base coinage

tr: illegitimate
having or showing an ignoble lack of honor or morality
example: that liberal obedience without which your army would be a base rabble"- Edmund Burk
taking a mean advantage
chok'd with ambition of the meaner sort"- Shakespear
something essentially vulgar and meanspirited in politics

tr: of low birth or station (`base' is archaic in this sense)
example: baseborn wretches with dirty faces
of humble (or lowly) birth

tr: serving as or forming a base
example: the painter applied a base coat followed by two finishing coats

tr: not adhering to ethical or moral principles
example: base and unpatriotic motives
a base, degrading way of life
cheating is dishonorable
they considered colonialism immoral
unethical practices in handling public funds

tr: (used of metals) consisting of or alloyed with inferior metal
example: base coins of aluminum
a base metal

value.def: The base of something is its lowest edge or part.

example.ex: There was a cycle path running along this side of the wall, right at its base...
example.tran: 在墙的这边，沿着墙根有一条自行车道。

example.ex: Line the base and sides of a 20cm deep round cake tin with paper.
example.tran: 把一个20厘米深的圆形糕饼盒的底部和四周都垫上纸。

value.def: The base of something is the lowest part of it, where it is attached to something else.

example.ex: The surgeon placed catheters through the veins and arteries near the base of the head.
example.tran: 外科医生在脑根部的静脉和动脉中放置了导管。

value.def: The base of an object such as a box or vase is the lower surface of it that touches the surface it rests on.

example.ex: Remove from the heat and plunge the base of the pan into a bowl of very cold water.
example.tran: 先把锅从炉子上拿开，然后把锅底浸入一盆冷水中。

value.def: The base of an object that has several sections and that rests on a surface is the lower section of it.

example.ex: The mattress is best on a solid bed base...
example.tran: 这种床垫最好放在结实的床板上。

example.ex: The clock stands on an oval marble base, enclosed by a glass dome.
example.tran: 钟放在椭圆形的大理石基座上，外罩玻璃罩。

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft n N

value.def: A base is a layer of something which will have another layer added to it.

example.ex: Spoon the mixture on to the biscuit base and cook in a preheated oven...
example.tran: 把混合好的糊糊舀到饼干坯上，然后放入已预热的烤箱烘烤。

example.ex: On many modern wooden boats, epoxy coatings will have been used as a base for varnishing.
example.tran: 很多现代的木船将采用环氧涂层作底漆。

value.def: A position or thing that is a base for something is one from which that thing can be developed or achieved.

example.ex: The post will give him a powerful political base from which to challenge the Kremlin...
example.tran: 这个职位将给他提供一个强有力的政治基点来挑战克里姆林宫。

example.ex: The family base was crucial to my development.
example.tran: 家庭基础对我的发展至关重要。

value.def: If you base one thing on another thing, the first thing develops from the second thing.

example.ex: He based his conclusions on the evidence given by the captured prisoners.
example.tran: 他根据被俘囚犯提供的证据得出了这个结论。

example.ex: Three of the new products are based on traditional herbal medicines...
example.tran: 有3种新产品是以传统的草药为基础研制的。

example.ex: The figures are based upon average market prices.
example.tran: 这些数字是基于平均市场价格而得出的。

value.def: A company's client base or customer base is the group of regular clients or customers that the company gets most of its income from.

example.ex: The company has been expanding its customer base using trade magazine advertising.
example.tran: 公司一直通过在商业杂志上刊登广告扩展客户群。

value.tran: （公司的）客户基础，主要（客户）群体

value.def: A military base is a place which part of the armed forces works from.

example.ex: Gunfire was heard at an army base close to the airport.
example.tran: 机场附近的军事基地传出了炮火声。

example.ex: ...a massive air base in eastern Saudi Arabia.
example.tran: 沙特阿拉伯东部的一个大型空军基地

value.def: Your base is the main place where you work, stay, or live.

example.ex: For most of the spring and early summer her base was her home in Scotland.
example.tran: 春天和初夏的大部分时间，她都是在苏格兰的家里度过的。

value.def: If a place is a base for a certain activity, the activity can be carried out at that place or from that place.

example.ex: The two hotel-restaurants are attractive bases from which to explore southeast Tuscany...
example.tran: 对于去托斯卡纳东南部探险的人们来说，这两家酒店是很有吸引力的驻扎地。

example.ex: Los Angeles was still my financial base. I was still doing business there.
example.tran: 洛杉矶仍然是我的财务中心。我还在那里做生意。

value.def: The base of a substance such as paint or food is the main ingredient of it, to which other substances can be added.

example.ex: Drain off any excess marinade and use it as a base for a pouring sauce...
example.tran: 先滗出多余的卤汁，把它当作浇汁的主料。

example.ex: Oils may be mixed with a base oil and massaged into the skin.
example.tran: 将油和基础油混合，按摩直至皮肤吸收。

value.tran: 基础成分；主要成分；主料

value.def: A base is a system of counting and expressing numbers. The decimal system uses base 10, and the binary system uses base 2.
A base in baseball, softball, or rounders is one of the places at each corner of the square on the pitch.
Base behaviour is behaviour that is immoral or dishonest.

example.ex: Love has the power to overcome the baser emotions.
example.tran: 爱能够战胜邪念。

value.def: If you say that someone is off base, you mean that they are wrong.

example.ex: Am I wrong? Am I way off base? Because I want you to set me straight if you think I'm wrong.
example.tran: 我错了吗？我大错特错了吗？因为如果我不对的话，我希望你能纠正我的错误。

value.def: If you communicate with someone, especially someone you have not communicated with recently, you can say that you touch base with them.

example.ex: Being there gave me a chance to touch base with three friends whom I had not seen for a year.
example.tran: 在那里，让我有机会和一年没见面的三个朋友取得了联系。

value.tran: （尤指在近期没有联系的情况下与某人）取得联系

value.def: If someone touches all the bases or covers the bases, they deal with everyone or everything involved in a situation.

example.ex: He has managed to touch all the bases necessary, and trade goes on...
example.tran: 他想方设法把所有必要的事情都处理妥当，生意也维持了下来。

example.ex: The boss covers all bases when he sets up a job.
example.tran: 老板设立一个工作岗位时，需要方方面面都考虑到。

value.tran: 面面俱到；应付各种情况

trans: (统称某种产品或服务的)客户
基站；基地台；基台；基地站；基准站
基地；基地面积；底面积；基区；基底面积
座钣（迫击炮）；底板；撑板；底盘
基类；基础类；基础类别；基底类别；只可能一个

rootsaffixes.indicate: = low, foundation 低, 下；基础
rootsaffixes.title: bas

partsOfSpeech.dec: a 加强 + base 低，下；基础 → 往低压〔自己〕→ 贬低〔自己〕
bas 低，下；基础 + e → 低下的
base 低，下；基础 + born 出生 → 出身卑微的
base 低，下；基础 + ment 具体物 → 地下室
base 低，下；基础 + ness 表状态 → 低下，卑微
bas 低，下；基础 + ic …的 → 基础的
bas 低，下；基础 + is 表性质 → 基础
bas 低，下；基础 + s → 低音的
de 使… + base 降低 → 降低；使卑下
sub 下 + base 基础 → 基层；基地
